Organs/Tissues: Human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes or primary cardiomyocytes
Cell Source: hiPSC-CMs or primary cardiac cells in 2D or 3D microtissues
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, if hydrogel or scaffold is used
3D Scaffold: Yes, can place 3D cardiac tissues in the chamber
Notable Features: Precisely controlled O₂ cycling to simulate infarction and reperfusion. Real-time optical access for live imaging or MEA integration
Plate/Format (Throughput): 1-well custom chamber, up to 6 chambers in device (low throughput)
Max Culture Duration: Hours to days (typical experiment ~24–48 h in device)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (microscope window, fluorescence or MEA recordings)
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No (only internal O₂/CO₂ control, no chemical sensors)
Gas Mix Controlled: Yes, fully programmable (hypoxia to normoxia, etc.)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes for O₂ changes; media changes require opening
model_availability: Product only (device + custom chamber), no direct service

Organs/Tissues: Cancer cell monolayers, tumor spheroids, or organoids
Cell Source: Cancer cell lines, patient-derived tumor organoids
Circulating Immune: No perfusion for immune infiltration, but can add immune cells statically
Air-Liquid Interface: Typically submerged, but possible ALI approach if needed
Notable Features: Mimics tumor microenvironment with low O₂, possibility of real-time imaging of growth or drug response under hypoxia
Plate/Format (Throughput): 1-well chamber, ~6 parallel units in device, low throughput
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Only post-experiment unless chamber is opened
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, organoids can be removed intact
Gas Mix Controlled: Yes, user sets O₂ level for tumor hypoxia (1%, 0.5%, etc.)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can adjust O₂ in real time; media changes require opening

Organs/Tissues: Endothelial + smooth muscle or alveolar epithelial-endothelial co-culture
Physiological/Pathological: Both – normal physoxia or pathological low O₂ for vascular remodeling
Cell Source: Primary human vascular cells or cell lines. Possible co-culture with fibroblasts or immune cells
Circulating Immune: Not in a flowing sense, but can be added statically
Air-Liquid Interface: Potentially yes, but usually submerged culture
3D Scaffold: Yes, user can place 3D vessel construct
Notable Features: Real-time imaging under controllable O₂ to study vascular remodeling, proliferation, or angiogenesis in hypoxia
Plate/Format (Throughput): 1-well sealed chamber, up to 6 in parallel (low throughput)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (microscopic observation of vascular cell behavior)
Perfused: No (static), though partial flow can be rigged externally
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, for O₂ changes in real time
